result.execSummary:
The defendant Ebony B Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 8 days sentence credit, if revoked.

Court will authorize the defendant's return to the State of Michigan immediately.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Reply to defendant's request for an expungement

Letter filed by defendant requesting an expungement.
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 10-02-19.** Request is denied as the defendant was not eligible because of age

records.descr: Order on Pet. to Expunge Court Rec. of Conviction

records.addlTxt:
Petition to Expunge Court Record of Conviction, Including Letter, JOC and Certificate of Discharge from Department of Conviction, filed by the Defendant.

04/10/18 - Court Reviewed - Request Denied - Defendant is not eligible. She was 30 at the time of the offense (she is not statutorily eligible for expunction).

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ebony B Gray in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Counts 11 & 12 are dismissed as read ins.




Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
8 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 15 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund the Balance to the Posting Party.

Court will authorize the defendant's return to the State of Michigan following court today.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
